title: What is the answer of a-(c +d) =? - Quora

response.answer_text: Simple, A-(C+D) = A-C-D Or with assumption follow the below rule. As per order operation rule PEDMAS P = Parenthesis E = Exponents D = Division M = Multiplication A = Addition S = Substraction A-(C+D) for (C+D)=B A-B is the answer For example, A = 10, C = 3, D = 6 Then, first solve (C+D) = (3+6) = 9 so B = 9 Now A = 10 A-B = 10–9 = 1 is the answer. Or with A-C-D, = 10–3–6 = 7–6 = 1
